page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING
page.content: {Dairy farming}is an{industry.} {Milk}is mainly produced in the{South {West}of {England. The milk that the cows produce must be germ free.To achieve this the cows{udder}must be cleaned before the milk is taken out. The milk must be cleaned to{4 degrees celsius}to stop bacteria from getting in to it. In Clawton the main breed of dairy cattle is the{British Friesian, it is very good because of its high milk yield.The{Jersey}is quite popular in Devon , for its high butter fat. Cows are now nearly all milked by {machine,}the machine is called a milker.A{milking parlour}is where the cows get milked,most parlours have a {bulk tank}it is a very large tank which keeps the milk cold until the {milk tanker}arrives.
